conclusion: To determine if the two objects have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze the slopes of their velocity-time curves at that specific time. Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, which is represented by the slope of the velocity-time graph.
The graph shows two curves, one for Object A (red) and one for Object B (black). The x-axis represents time (\( t \)), and the y-axis represents velocity (\( v \)).
Find the point \( t_1 \) on the x-axis.
At time \( t_1 \), the velocity of Object A is decreasing, and the slope of the curve is negative.
At time \( t_1 \), the velocity of Object B is also decreasing, and the slope of the curve is negative.

premise: To have the same acceleration, the slopes (representing acceleration) of both curves at \( t_1 \) must be equal.
conclusion: The slope of Object A's curve appears to be less steep compared to Object B's curve.

premise: Since the slopes of the velocity-time curves for Object A and Object B at \( t_1 \) are not the same (Object B has a steeper slope),
conclusion: the accelerations of the two objects at \( t_1 \) are different.
